ranked_diseases.explanation: Tuberous Sclerosis Complex is characterized by cortical tubers, angiofibromas, and renal angiomyolipomas, matching all the phenotypic features given.
Birt-Hogg-Dubé Syndrome can present with angiofibromas and renal tumors, though it less commonly features cortical tubers compared to Tuberous Sclerosis Complex.
Neurofibromatosis Type 1 can show skin lesions similar to angiofibromas, but is less consistent with cortical tubers and renal angiomyolipomas compared to other conditions.
